section.para: This is the code repository for Transmutex. This code is used to simulate an Accelerator Driven System (ADS). This code is the property of Transmutex SA. All rights reserved.

In the root directory, you will find source files .cc and the header files .hh respectively in the following directories ./TMXElements/src/ and ./TMXElements/include/ These files constitutes general classes which are used to simulate specific features of a nuclear reactor (such as burn-up).

In the root directory, you will find source files .cc and the header files .hh respectively in the following directories ./G4-NeutronTransport/src/ and ./G4-NeutronTransport/include/ These files constitutes a GEANT4 simulation which is used to design the Transmutex's ADS. The main file of this simulation is ./G4-NeutronTransport/ads_transmutex.cc

section.title: Make build directory
section.para: If the directory ./build/ does not exist, make a directory named "build" with the following command: mkdir build
Go in the directory "build" with the following command: cd build

section.title: Configure cmake files
section.para: Configure CMake to build the application cmake ..
If an error occur during the configuration, edit and correct the CMakeFile with ccmake .. Then hit c and g to configure and generate the files

section.title: Build the application
section.para: Build the application with the following command: make -jN With N = number of available cores

section.title: Launch the application
section.para: Launch the application from the build/ directory with the following command: ./bin/ads_transmutex ../G4-NeutronTransport/param.csv

section.title: The parameter file
section.para:
The parameter file param.csv has to be configured by the user before each run.
This file defines the parameters of the simulation, it is located in G4-NeutronTransport/

section.title: Description of the parameter file
section.para:
The parameter file can be visualized with MS Excel or a text file.
It consists in table organized as follows:
|Parameter name|Value|Units|Parameter description|

section.title: Reading of the file
section.para:
The separators used to read the file are:
, to separate each element
\n,\r,\n\r or empty string "" to detect the end of a line

One line corresponds to a single parameter except for the core configuration or a position vector (X,Y,Z)
To link a line to a specific parameter, the code reads the first element of each line which correspond to the parameter name.
The parameter name is hard-coded in the code TMXInputParameters.cc that can be found in ./TMXElements/src/.
Thus, the parameter name in the parameter file must not be changed without changing its name in TMXInputParameters.cc.

section.title: Parameters description
section.para:
Parameter name
Value
Units
Parameter description
Always required
boolVisualization
boolean
no
Activation of the visualization
yes
nThreads
integer
no
Number of thread per run
yes
isThreadMerging
boolean
no
(Default: true) Activation of merging of thread's ROOT file into master's ROOT file per run
no
int_Option
integer
no
The code will run in different modes following this option:
yes
| | | | 0 = Simulate all the geometry,
| | | | 1 = Target only,
| | | | 2 = Target + Surroundings (no core),
| | | | 3 = Homogenous geometry,
| | | | 4 = keff calculation with dedicated method,
| | | | 5 = Transmutation calculation,
| | | | 6 = reflector skin w/o water (Tro√Øtsk),
| | | | 7 = the multiplication is killed,
| | | | 8 = Calculation of ksource without (n,Xn)),
| | | | 9 = Old version (Energy Amplifier) of k_source with E<20MeV,
| | | | 20 = Calculation of k with power iteration method | | | | 30 = Monte Carlo Volume Estimator | Verbose | 0 or 1 | no | Verbose of the code | yes |
| BeamEnergy | double | [GeV, MeV, keV, eV] | Energy of source particles | yes |
| Nparticles | integer | no | Number of events to simulate. In most of cases there is 1 source particle/event. In case of a k_{eff} calculation there are ~120 source particles/event. | yes |
| Nrun | integer | no | Number of runs to consider for burn-up calculations | yes |
| TimeOfRun | double | [ns, um, ms, s, mn, h, d, m, y] | Real time of 1 run to consider for burn-up calculations | yes |
| P_beam | double | [mW, W, kW, MW, GW, TW] | Beam power | yes |
| Geometry | integer | no | Geometry to be used in the calculation | yes |
| | | | 0 = Tro√Øtsk
| | | | 1 = CVR Rez
| | | | 2 = Test
| | | | 4 = EAP80 Simplified
| | | | 5 = Sandbox (burnup tests, LBE test, criticality benchmarks, ...)
| | | | 6 = KIPT
| | | | 7 = EAP80 Subcritical
| | | | 8 = EAP80 Critical
| | | | 9 = Rez2011 Subcritical
| | | | 10 = SVBR100 + TMXTarget
| str_ROOTFileName | string | no | Name of the output ROOT files (ex: myfile.root). This name will be used to produce any other output files with the appropriate extension. | yes |
| physName | string | no | Name of the physical model to use (QGSP_BIC_HP, FTFP_BERT_HP, etc.) | yes |
| isAbla | boolean | no | Use of ABLA v3 model | yes |
| PrintModulo | integer | no | Print the calculation status every PrintModulo events | yes |
| TemperatureWorld | double | K | Temperature of every material except the fuel (20¬∞C = 293.15 K) | yes |
| TemperatureFuel | double | K | Temperature of the fuel (20¬∞C = 293.15 K) | yes |
| NbDiscardCycle | integer | no | Number of cycle to discard from the keff calculation with option 20 | ErrorLimitMCCubicVolume | double | no | Error (%) upper limit on the estimation of the volume with the Monte Carlo method with option 30 | | MCCubicVolumeLVname | string | no | (Optional, not use if no string provided) Logical Volume cubic volume estimation by slice along Z axis using parallelWorld definition option 30 with a logical volume name | no | | ExtSourcePath | string | no | Path to an external source file (example: ./EAP80_TMXSource.txt ) | no | | worldR | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Radius of the world volume | yes |
| worldZ | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Half height of the world volume | yes |
| h0 | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Height between the bottom of the pit and the center of the world volume (concrete) in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| XtargetPosition | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Position of the target along the beam axis (0 = center of the driver fuel) in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| CheckGap | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Target tube thickness | no |
| check1r | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Tube internal radius | no |
| xTarget | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | half Target thickness in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| yTarget | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | half Target width in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| zTargetHeight | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | half Target height (Oz) in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| nT | integer | no | nT+1 = number of the target placing in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| xVariable | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Distance between 2 target plates in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| Target_Al_Xgap | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Gap between target plates and Aluminium parts along X-axis in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| Target_Al_Ygap | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Gap between target plates and Aluminium parts along Y-axis in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| Al_thickness | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Thickness of Aluminium part (empty structure) in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| Al_Tube_gap | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Gap between Aluminium parts and the tube containing the target (fLogicCheck1U) in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| airtopR | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Radius of the air cylinder in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| AirTopZdistanceFromBottomtoTop | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Distance between the bottom of the pit and the top of the air cylinder in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| reflectorZdistanceFromBottomtoTop | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Distance between the bottom of the pit and the top of the water-cooled heat shield (reflector) in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| fetopZ | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Half Height (thickness) of the iron part on the top of the water-cooled heat shield (reflector) in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| Cool10ZdistanceFromBottomtoBottom | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Distance between the bottom of the pit and the bottom of the experimental area (~reflector bottom thickness) | no |
| cool10R | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Radius of the experimental area in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| cool10BottomGap | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Air gap at the bottom between the water-cooled heat shield (reflector) and the lead volume in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| CoreShape | string | Hexagonal or Cylindrical | Shape of sub-critical core (Hexagonal or Cylindrical) in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| FuelPlacement | string | Hexagonal or Cylindrical | placement of the fuel in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| Rpos_fuel | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Radial position of the first rod in the fuel assembly (from 0 to external rod side) in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| FuelName | string | [VVR-M5, VVR-M2-20p, VVR-M2-36p, IBR-2M] | Name of the fuel rods in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| int_Nreplicate | integer | no | Number of fuel elements per layer in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| int_Nlayer | double | no | Number of layers for fuel assembly (double because 1.5 layer is ok) in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| dbl_rRodsGap | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Gap between 2 fuel rods in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| GraphiteThickness | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Thickness of the graphite reflector by the lead in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| AbsorberThickness | double | [nm, um, mm, cm, dm, m] | Thickness of the neutron absorber between the lead and the Fuel driver in Tro√Øtsk | no |
| PathToCoreLatticeFile | string | no | Path to the lattice configuration of the Core | no |
| PathToAssemblyLatticeFile | string | no | Path to the lattice configuration of the Assembly | no |

entry.para: number of bins in the Radial direction
number of bins in the Theta-axis
number of bins in the X-axis
number of bins in the Y-axis
number of bins in the Z-axis
Score the energy deposit in eV in the PV's volume
Score the surface current of the PV' surface
Score the surface fluence of the PV' surface in particle/cm2
Score the volume fluence in the PV's volume in particle/cm2

listitem.para: ParticleName must be in G4 syntax (ex: neutron, proton, Pb208, ...), empty = score all particles
ParticleNameToScore can be an union of Physical Volumes. Place a + between each PV (ex: PV1+PV2)
PVname+ score in PVname and all the volumes inside of PVname. It is recommended to set one PVname (ex: PV1+)

entry.para: bin1, min1, max1, bin2, min2, max2
Score the energy deposition per volume unit in eV/cm3

listitem.para: The user can add numbers to the distribution type (for example RZ8) to differentiate the spatial scoring with different binning.

section.title: Example of Scoring
section.para:
Suppose a Sphere 1 named S1 which contains two smaller spheres S2:1 and S2:2. Each of these spheres contains a single sphere S3:1 and S3:2 respectively. Structure:
S1
S2:1
S3:1
S2:2
S3:2
Scoring
Overall volume fluence spectrum of neutron: VolumeFluenceSpectrum,neutron,S1+,
Overall volume fluence spectrum in S2:1: VolumeFluenceSpectrum,,S2:1+S3:1, or VolumeFluenceSpectrum,,S2:1+,
Overall volume fluence spectrum in S2:1 and S2:2: VolumeFluenceSpectrum,,S2:1+S3:1+S2:2+S3:2, or VolumeFluenceSpectrum,,S2:1+S2:2+,
Volume fluence spectrum in S2:1 only (without S3:1): VolumeFluenceSpectrum,,S2:1,
Surface fluence spectrum of neutrons across S2:1 and S2:2: SurfaceFluenceSpectrum,neutron,S2:1+S2:2
If S2:1 and S2:2 are copies, it is possible to score S3 (S3:1 and S3:2 if PVname is S3) in one score: VolumeFluenceSpectrum,,S3,
In this case, the user has to be very careful on the volume calculation and on the volumes scored.
In this case, it is not possible to score only the S3 contained in S2:1 for example.
It is recommended to avoid copy when each copy needs to be scored individually.

entry.para: Score information of neutrons into an ntuple
number of bins in the X or R dimension
number of bins in the Y or Theta dimension
number of bins in the Z-axis
Proton energy cutoff in target region
Gamma energy cutoff in target region
e-/e+ energy cutoff in target region
Proton energy cutoff in lead region
Gamma energy cutoff in lead region
e-/e+ energy cutoff in lead region
Proton energy cutoff in fuel region
Gamma energy cutoff in fuel region
e-/e+ energy cutoff in fuel region
Proton energy cutoff in world region
Gamma energy cutoff in world region
e-/e+ energy cutoff in world region

section.title: Source definition
section.para:
| SourceType | string | no | Type of source : which reactor (e.g. KIPT, Rez), which generation of neutrons (e.g. ADS, Rad), which variant (e.g. 1, 2), what place in the reactor (e.g. center, channel). All attached, not ordered. Only the type of reactor and the type of neutron generation are necessary. | no | | SourceNumber | integer | no | number of sources followed by the vectors of direction and position in mm | no |
| src_XYZdirection | double | (X1,Y1,Z1),(X2,Y2,Z2),etc. in mm | Direction vector of the source and beam pipe | no |
| src_XYZdirection | double | (X1,Y1,Z1),(X2,Y2,Z2),etc. in mm | Position vector of the center of the spallation target | no |
| src_slabThicknesses | double | e1, e2, etc. in mm | Thickness if each slab | no |

section.title: Detection chamber definition
section.para: Geometrical definition and scoring of the neutron flux are separate : The scoring has to be added to the parameters on top of the geometry. For Detectors having a detection media (e.g. fissile coating for fission chambers)

section.title: Core definition (WDISPL, REFL, IRT4M6T, IRT4M8T, LEAD, VOID)
section.para:
| PathToBurnupFile | string | no | Path to the file containing fuel composition related to its burnup | no |
| CoreConfig,A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H | | | | |
| CoreConfig | string | A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H | | |
| CoreConfig_Raw10 | string | WDISPL/EWDISPL, REFL/EREFL, IRT4M6T, IRT4M8T, LEAD, VOID, FAST | 8 elements to be defines ; _14.5 search the closest fuel burnup composition in a file given by CVR ; _CR0.65 add a control rod in the middle;EREFL/EWDISPL are analog to REFL/WDISPL but with an empty cylinder in the middle; to place detection chamber inside _DCTYP0 add a detection chamber of type TYP at height 0 in cm in the assembly; | no |
| CoreConfig_Raw9 | string | WDISPL/EWDISPL, REFL/EREFL, IRT4M6T, IRT4M8T, LEAD, VOID, FAST | 8 elements to be defines | no |
| CoreConfig_Raw8 | string | WDISPL/EWDISPL, REFL/EREFL, IRT4M6T, IRT4M8T, LEAD, VOID, FAST | 8 elements to be defines | no |
